TopicTitle: can't continue in training ->advanced construction->Abort Group

Articles.Content:
After doing what the instruction say, add Decouple+Shutdown+Decouple, but the next is gray, and just can't continue.

what can i do to fix this?

I see one of your selections in the action group is for the "Hammer" solid rocket booster. SRBs can't be shut down, so Werner might be having an aneurysm. Try removing only the RT-10 Hammer from your action group and see if that works.

Same problem here. Any solutions?. I'm having:

1- TR-18A Stack Decoupler (Decouple)

2- LV-909 "Terrier" Liquid fuel (Shutdown engine)

3- TT-38K Radial Decoupler (Decouple)

On 24/06/2016 at 7:43 AM, kegin said:

After doing what the instruction say, add Decouple+Shutdown+Decouple, but the next is gray, and just can't continue.

what can i do to fix this?

I May be wrong having never done the training but I think you've missed one of the stack decouplers (I think there's two on that craft)

On 2016-06-23 at 10:43 PM, kegin said:

After doing what the instruction say, add Decouple+Shutdown+Decouple, but the next is gray, and just can't continue.

what can i do to fix this?

 

You may have selected the wrong stack decoupler, make sure its the one directly below the pod, and not the one between your first n second stage

4 hours ago, Drums of mankind said:

Same problem here. Any solutions?. I'm having:

1- TR-18A Stack Decoupler (Decouple)

2- LV-909 "Terrier" Liquid fuel (Shutdown engine)

3- TT-38K Radial Decoupler (Decouple)

check to make sure the stack decoupler you selected is the one below the pod, and not the one between your first n second stage

8 hours ago, Drums of mankind said:

Same problem here. Any solutions?. I'm having:

1- TR-18A Stack Decoupler (Decouple)

2- LV-909 "Terrier" Liquid fuel (Shutdown engine)

3- TT-38K Radial Decoupler (Decouple)

If that's all you have, then you missed the "Shutdown" function on the Swivel engine.

had same issue, was going nuts!

1) the comment about removing the shutdown from Hammer (aneurysm) is accurate.  <Next> will be gray if the Hammer is set to shutdown

2) the comment about missing Shutdown on the Swivel engine = also accurate.  I completely forgot about that engine.  the one at the super bottom.  oops.

 

thanks to both of you, jimbo and bewing!  that was frustrating.

This was SOOO frustrating but I finally figured it out with the clue in the text "...click on each liquid engine..."

Too bad I didn't know the terminology anywhere well enough by this stage to know which type of engine is which. I had to read this thread a couple of times before I realised the relevant parts.

I *WISH* the action items for each step of the tutorials were bullet pointed and used exact names. Reading through all that stuff might add flavour but it's a pain in the neck! Especially with the text sized the way it is (yes, I have the UI scaled to 150% but I'm OLD and I can't see, no, not even with my good glasses).
